intro: Sida suborbicularis, commonly known as the round-leaved sida, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, round or oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale pink or white, and it produces small, dry fruits called capsules. Sida suborbicularis is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
